text: ORLANDO (57), in a steamy room lying on a bed bare-cheste in an old-fashioned sauna.
Orlando lying face down on a massage bed. A MASSEUR begin massage his back.
Orlando already dressed, goes up the stairs and leaves th sauna. On the glass window of it, we can see a neon sign reads its name: “FINLANDIA”. He walks the streets of Santiago.
Orlando sitting on his desk calls her secretary, they tal speaker phone.
Monica... Have you seen a big white envelope that was sitting here on my desk?
No, Sr. I haven~t seen it.

Thank you. He hangs up the phone. EXT. PARKING LOT - ORLANDO’S CAR -- DAY 5 Orlando looks for the envelope on the car’s glove box, no luck. He goes to the trunk of the car, goes through magaz and boxes, the envelope is not there. INT. HOTEL —- HALLWAY -- NIGHT 6 Orlando crosses the lobby of a middle-range hotel and hea to the front desk.
Hello.
Good afternoon.
Could I bother you for a piece of paper and an envelope?
Yes of course. Let me see... The receptionist gives Orlando a piece of paper and envel He writes something on it.
Great
Orlando on the elevator, he puts the envelope on the pock of his jacket.

The place is packed with people. On a small stage, a band playing Caribbean music. Orlando walks in as an attractive and electric young woma MARINA (27), sings a salsa song with grace and talent. There’s something strong and magnetic about her, A SLIGHT ROUGH FEMININITY... Is she a transsexual woman? No one at the bar is paying much attention to Marina’s performance, except for Orlando, who stares at her, fascinated and sings along softly.
Orlando and Marina walk into a Chinese restaurant’s hyper decorated waiting lounge. A CHINESE RECEPTIONIST greets t at their arrival.
Good night.  10
Good night.
I made a reservation for Orlando Onetto.
One second. Yes, that~s right. Table 41.
Thank you.
Come with me.
Yes.

Sitting at a table, Orlando and Marina are with two Chine waiters standing besides them with a cake and sparkling candle, they sing happy birthday in Chinese. Marina laugh and blows the candle. The waiters and Orlando clap their hands.
Thank you Orlando.
Thank you! (to the waiter)
I'll bring out some slices. The waiters leave.
Thank you.
Thank you my love.
With a musical cake and everything! Orlando pulls the envelope out of the pocket jacket.
Here. Marina receives the envelope and opens it.
How formal. “Valid for two airline tickets to the Iguazu Falls.” Orlando!
It's no small thing. It's one of the seven natural wonders of the world.
Oh wow! And when are we going?
In ten days.
In ten days... Marina stands up and walks to Orlando. She hughs him from behind and kiss him in the mouth.
Hey, and why is it “valid for”?
It’s a long story...
You haven~t bought them yet?  11 12 13
Yes... I bought them and printed them out, and I put them in an envelope.
Okay, and?
And I had them with me at the sauna.
And?
And I can’t remember where the fuck I put them.
Poor old man with senile dementia. They laugh and kiss again.
Later they dance to a slow song and kiss. INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT -- NIGHT 12 Orlando has a hard time getting his key in the lock.

We're going to have to ask the doorman for some help. They are both a little drunk and tired, they laugh and Orlando finally manages to open the door. We hear the bar of a dog. INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM -- NIGHT 13 It’s a large and elegant apartment, with view of the city Orlando and Marina make love in the dim light. They are p connection.  14 15 6. INT. ORLANDO'S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM -- NIGHT 14 The silence in the room is suddenly interrupted by Orland gasping sounds. Marina turns the light on. Orlando is sitting up at his s of the bed with his back turned towards her, having difficulty breathing.
Orlando? Orlando tries to say something to her, but no words come
Orlando, What’s wrong?!
I don’t know.
You don’t know?
I don’t know what’s wrong with me. Orlando stands up from the bed, tries to walk but falls d Marina runs to grabs him.
Orlando! What the fuck is going on? Come here. Marina manages to sit Orlando on the bed.
Honey... What is it?
Marina carries Orlando outside the apartment. He puts him against the wall.
Lean against the wall. Look at me. Here. Marina puts Orlando’s glasses to him. She searches for something in her bag.  16
The keys, do you have them?
No... Marina search for the keys on Orlando’s shirt. No luck.
Orlando... She runs back to the apartment.
Wait here. No, Diabla, stop! Come here! Orlando stars walking with diffulty to the stair case. Th lights go out and he fells through the stairs.
Orlando? Marina sees him and runs through the staircase. DIABLA, t dog comes along and barks.
Orlando! Orlando, honey! Marina tries to put Orlando on his feet.
I’m fine.

Let's go! INT. ORLANDO’S CAR -- NIGHT 16 Marina drives nervously; the streets are empty. She notic that Orlando is in a lot of pain, unable to speak, in the passenger seat next to her. She looks forward again.
Honey, talk to me, ok? He doesn’t respond.
Talk to me! Orlando! Please...  17 He barely reacts.
(mumbling) Where are we going?
To the hospital, Orlando, where else? Focus, okay? Orlando slips into unconsciousness once more, without eno energy to decide.
Hurry up.
What?
Hurry up.
Ok, Ok. He barely responds, and drives off at full speed.

head_text.subj: I/E. ORLANDO'S CAR / HOSPITAL / EMERGENCY ROOM / REANIMAT

text: Marina brings the car to a screeching halt at a HOSPITAL entrance, honking her horn. She gets out of the car.
Help, please! One PARAMEDIC runs to the car.
Easy, ma’am. Let us take care of him... (TO ORLANDO)
Are you OK? What’s your name? Can you hear me? (TO PARAMEDIC 2)

Juan Pablo, hurry up! Hurry! Two more paramedics arrive with a stretcher and try to pu Orlando out of the car; it’s a difficult task because his arms and legs are rigid and stuck in his seat. Orlando’s is HIT SEVERAL TIMES in the process.
Be careful... careful! Despite his limp state, they manage to pull him out of th car.
Be careful. They drag him towards the hospital.
What~s your name? What~s your name? Can you hear me?
His name is Orlando.
(as they advance) What happened?
I don’t know what happened!
What medication is he taking?
None
How old is he?
Fifty-seven.
Hurry up, he’s not responding! Did he feel sick at some point?
When he woke up... He had a headache, and he was acting strange.
When was that?  18 10.
Like fifteen or twenty minutes ago. Marina anxiously watches how the nurses push Orlando into Reanimation cubicle. Impulsively, she follows them inside

Male patient, 57 years old, loss of consciousness, his head is bleeding. Let's go. 1,2,3... Marina, standing motionless in one corner of the cubicle, observes how the paraemdics and nurses work. Due to the emergency, no one realizes that she has entere the reanimation cubicle and is still there, watching everything, looking disoriented. A FEMALE NURSE sees her draws closer.
Ma’am, you have to wait outside.
I brought him here as fast as I could.

Please, you have to wait outside. We'll take care of him, okay? Stay calm. Go, go... The Nurse pulls her out of the cubicle. Marina stares through the glass door how the paramedics t Orlando. She walks back and lean on the wall.
Marina is left alone, standing in front of the cubicle’s by herself. She waits for several seconds... Until the NURSE appears with some of Orlando’s belongings
Are you a family member?
No. I just brought him here.
You don’t know him?  11.
Yes, we're friends.
(suspiciously) Oh. (rushed) These are his things. They can’t stay in there.
How is he doing? (to the nurse)
They’11 let you know. Just wait a little longer. The Female Nurse leaves, Marina waits for several tense seconds. Until a DOCTOR (60), projecting status and authority, emerges and faces her.
Good night.
Good night.
(tactfully) Are you a member of Mr. Onetto’s family? Marina draws closer to him.
Yes The Doctor looks at her for a moment, scrutinizing her.
Are you his partner?
Yes, we’re partners. The Doctor raises the volume of his voice in order to dra her out of her state of shock.
Excuse me, your name is...?
Marina Vidal  19 20 12.
But... that’s a nickname?
Excuse me?
Could you come with me? So that we can speak in private...
Is something wrong? They begin walking through the hallway, they talk but we can’t hear what the doctor is saying.

Marina enters the bathroom, she is alone. She breathes heavily and enters a bathroom cubicle. She fall off her knees, her head leans on the floor. The breathing gets lo and powerful. She washes her face and looks in the mirror. She can’t believe what happened.
Marina is calling GABO, the phone rings for several secon
(into the phone, sounding sleepy) Orlando
I’m Orlando’s friend.
Excuse me, who is this?
This is Marina. I’m
Yes, I know who you are.
The thing is, Orlando was feeling sick.  13.
When?
About an and a half hour ago. And I brought him to the hospital, but... uh...
Which hospital?
Saint Thomas. He had a crisis in the car.
Ok.
And he died.
He died?! Marina stutters. Pause.
Yes. Just now... I’m so sorry.
Hello? (long pause)
Yes, I’m here. Have you called anyone else?
No, no one.
Ok.
But I need someone to come here. I can’t handle all of this.
Okay, don’t worry, I'll let the family know.  21 22 14.
Okay.
Don’t call anyone. Ok?
ok Gabo hands up. Marina looks around nervously; no one seem be watching her. She evaluates the situation. Slyly begin walk away, towards the street.

Marina begins to walk away from the hospital at a firm pa She'd rather avoid the conflict, and Gabo has already bee given notice... She begins to jog quickly. She advances a few blocks, but A patrol car pulls over and a POLICE OFFICER (30) comes d A light flashes over both of them.
Miss Marina Vidal?
Yes, what is it?
The low-ranking police officer walks with Marina through hospital hallway. A CHIEF POLICE OFFICER and the doctor a waiting for her.
Sargent
Thank you
Excuse me The low ranking police officer leaves.
(to the doctor) You didn’t have to treat me like a criminal.  15.
(to the chief police officer) I’ll leave you to your work, excuse me. The doctor leaves.
(to Marina, firmly) Miss, I need your information.
Here? The Chief Police Officer has little patience.
Here. Full name
Marina--
(exasperated) Do you have an ID card with you? Marina returns his stare, then gives up and pulls her ID of her handbag. After looking at it, the Chief Police Off gazes at her severely.
My new ID card is still pending, sir.
Until you receive it, this is still your legal name.
My name is Marina Vidal. Is there a problem with that?
Why did you run off? Gabo arrives from behind. Marina doesn’t see him.
Why am I being detained?  16.
You're not being detained, sir. Marina looks at him with a serious expression on her face
Then why do you have my ID card?
Good night. Marina turns and sees a scruffy, bald man with a potbelly waiting attentively a few meters away. It’s GABO (55), wh wearing an orthopedic boot.
Marina? Thank you for everything. I’m sorry you had to go through all of this. I’m Gabo.
(nervous, remorseful) Hello Gabo.
How are you? Gabo comes closer to greet her with a kiss on the cheek, hesitates, and finally greets her with a handshake.
Hi. How are you? He then greets the Chief Police Officer, who is trying to figure them out.
Gabriel Onetto, I’m the brother of the deceased. Is something the matter?
(gesturing towards Marina) No, everything is fine. He came brought him to the hospital and then wanted to leave in a hurry, but we needed to speak to him.
Well, you can speak to me. I’m his family, and I’m going to handle everything. (MORE )
You must understand that the lady here was with my brother when he died, so it’s a sensitive situation. The Chief police handles back Marina’s ID.
Thanks.
(to Marina) Your phone number, please. Humiliated, Marina dictates her phone number to him.
Yes... 98149575. INT. ORLANDO’S CAR -- DAY 23 Nervous, Marina drives Orlando’s car at considerable spee
Marina makes her way down a narrow hallway, between amuse park games.
Marina already with her apron on. She is hitting on a punching game.
(off) Marina, we need you out here!
I’m going. She makes a final strong punch.
Marina tries to function normally while she attend a coup of costumers. She carries a tray with used dishes.  18.
Is everything all right?
Yes, thank you.
Okay.
Excuse me, could I have a glass of water?
Yes, right away. ALESSANDRA (45), Marina’s strong and stylish boss, it’s i the bar writing something down. Marina approaches.
You didn’t want to come, and I was just calling you to ask if you could take the night shift. Crap.
I didn’t get to check my phone, Alessandra. The celebration was pretty intense.
But you came. I appreciate that. Do you need anything?
No... Everything is fine.
Are you sure?
Yes, I’m sure.
Always so mysterious.  27 19.
It’s been ringing for a while.
Thank you. Marina takes the phone, she leaves the tray on a table an excuses herself from her colleagues.
(pretending everything is fine) Hello She makes her way to the second floor.
While she walks through the second floor and hallway tryi to look for a quite place to talk.
Hello? I’m Sonia. Orlando's wife. I mean, his ex-wife.
I know. How are you?
There’s no need for the formality. (silence) Look, I talked to Gabo, and he told me that you’re living in Orlando's apartment. Is that true?
Yes, it’s true.
Well, I’1l be needing his car.
Of course.
You could have left the car with Gabo.
He didn’t want it. Look ma'am... Look. (MORE)
Tell me when you need it and I can drop it off.
Let’s see... Tomorrow. Could you drop it off at my office tomorrow? I’1ll text you the address, and... You can leave it in the parking lot. You can ask there... And they’11 tell you where to park.
At 10:30? Is that time OK?
I’1l work it out.
Anything else of his that you might have?
No. Just the intimate things.
(hurt, delirious) Well, we’ll have to work out what to do about the apartment. A long silence.
Of course.
I'd like for you to handle all practical affairs with me, okay?
All right. Could we talk about that when we meet? I'm working right now.  21.
The restaurant is packed and Marina can barely keep it together.
(from another table) Are you going to bring us our check, or not?
Right away.
Marina, someone’s looking for you outside.
Who?
I Don’t know.
Where?
At the entrance. Marina looks concern.
Marina walks towards the entrance. An attractive woman, ADRIANA (45), is standing waiting for her.
(holding a file in her hands ) Good afternoon, Marina. Thank you for coming out, this is just going to take two minutes.
Hello
Hello. I’m Detective Adriana Cortes, from the Investigations Police’s Sexual Offenses Unit. Good afternoon.  22. They shake hands.
Good afternoon.

Well first of all, I wanted to offer you my condolences. They told me what happened, and I’m really sorry. The fact that you run away from the hospital, gave me some reason for concern. Marina feels uncomfortable.
Could we talk over there?
Of course... They walk towards a more private place. They star walking
I didn’t run away.
Oh. There must have been some confusion, then.
Could I see your identification, please?
Sure Adriana show it to her. She really is a police detective.
One question. Mr. Orlando...
Onetto.
Yes. Was he paying you?
(offended) We were a couple.  23.
So you cared for each other. It wasn’t just sexual. Marina begins to feel irritated.
It was a consensual relationship between two adults. Why do you want to know that?
Because he was old enough to be your father. (Marina holds back) Did you use drugs before his attack?
No.
Alcohol?
Yes.
Did you have sex?
I don’t remember. Long silence.
I need to know if he suffered any kind of physical stress.
Nothing unusual.

The thing is, Mr. Onetto’s body arrived to the hospital with injuries, with bruises. He had injuries on his arms, on his sides, on his neck. And a contusion to his head. Marina grows frightened. Adriana opens the file she has brought along with her and shows it to Marina.  24. There are pictures inside. Marina looks at them, then sna it shut, affected.
I talked to the doctor about all of this. Did you talk to his family? Marina is confused. Alessandra appears at the door.
Marina! Excuse me... We’re having problems with the check for table 15.
I’m coming.
Five minutes, please. (to Alessandra) Alessandra goes back inside. Adriana fixes her gaze on Marina. Can't anyone fill in for you? (to Marina)
No. And I really need to get back to work... Or they’1l fire me.

Look, I’ve been working on the streets for 23 years. 14 years on the Sexual Offenses Unit. I have a Master’s degree on the subject. I know very well what happens with people... Sorry, with women like you. Because I’ve seen it all. All. Adriana carries on in her sensitive, condescending tone.
I want you to know that I understand and support you. Did you have to defend yourself from him?
Am I being arrested?  25.
No
Then I’m leaving, because I really... Adriana try to grab Marina’s hand.
Wait, let’s do something. (handing her a card) Call me when you’re done here so we can talk properly. So that I can sleep tonight, okay? Marina head back, Adriana follows her.
Talk about what?
I‘1l be waiting for your call. Marina is forced to nod her head. She puts the card away.
And it’s best if you don’t leave Santiago. (walking towards the restaurant)
Okay, goodbye.
Marina returns to the dining room as Adriana leaves, tryi to look normal.
Goodbye, Marina. (to Alessandra) Thank you, the place looks great!
Thank you. Marina and Alessandra watch her leave.  30 31 32 26.
Is everything all right?
Yes, everything okay.
I tried to rescue you, did you notice?
Yes, I noticed, thank you.
Are you telling me what the fuck is going on?
Can it be some another time? I've had a terrible day.

Sure. Alessandra nods, and Marina returns to her hectic job. INT. ORLANDO’S CAR -- AFTERNOON 30 Marina, tired and humiliated, is driving Orlando’s car. S arrives to the apartment and parks the car. Everything is silence, she sees the ghost of Orlando. Her breathing bec heavy. She grabs from the floor a key with the number 181 written on it, her hands tremble. She gets down from the and whispers a song while he walks through the parking lo INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM -- AFTERNOON 31 Marina continues whispering “Spossa” while she walks thro the apartment and collapses on the couch. Diabla approach and seats with her.
Diabla! Hi to you. INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM -- NIGHT 32 Marina looks very tired, she is on her pyjamas. She liste to a voicemail Adriana left on her cell phone.  33 34 27.

(on the phone, in a serene tone) Marina, this is Detective Cortes speaking. I imagine you must have a good reason for standing up an Investigations officer. Now, I’m not going to ask, I’m going to demand that you come in and talk to me tomorrow. I'll be at the Forensic Medical Service, look for me when you get there, I’ll see you at 12:30. Don’t call me. No excuses. I’m not interested. Oh, and please don’t make me send someone to pick you up. INT. ORLANDO'S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM -- NIGHT 33 Marina pretends to be boxing as she did earlier that day. She opens Orlando’s closet and immerse her head between h cloths. She lays face up on the bed, lights a joint and smoke. Sh tries to relax her self through her breathing.

Day has broken, and Marina opens her eyes. Diabla barking wakes her up. She hears a masculine voice inside the apartment. BRUNO (29) its in the hallway playing with Dia Marina seems really surprise and upset.
Are you Marisa?
Marina
I’m Bruno. Awkward silence.
I’m sorry, I thought there was no one here. Bruno walks toward the living room and Marina puts a swea on. She goes to the leaving room to meet with Bruno.  28.
What happened, Marisa?
Your dad suddenly started feeling sick. Everything happened really fast.
What were you doing?
Sleeping.
(affected) And that’s all? You were with him and, he died? Just like that?
We ran to the hospital.
His body was bruised. Why the fuck was his body bruised? An injury to his head.
(affected) He felt down the stairs when we were going down. That’s why. Bruno notices the unopened boxes and suitcases.
What about those suitcases?
I was moving in.
Shit. Bruno gets down to pat Diabla.
What are we going to do with you, Diabla?
Orlando gave her to me. I’m sorry.  29.
He gave you Diabla? That really sucks. Bruno stands up and walks through the apartment, he sits the leaving room. Marina stays standing.

Look... I slept with this dog for years. But I had to stop doing it. I didn’t like the smell. Did you know that there are two kinds of people with pets? Those who have mammals, and those who prefer birds or reptiles. Mammals, we have a neocortex. The most developed layer of neural tissue, Where emotions are generated. That’s where empathy, tenderness... ...and love are generated.
(upset) I don’t see anyone with a lizard around here. I don't get you analysis. Or are you trying to say something else?
I°m not trying to say anything.
Aha.
Have you gotten the operation?
You can’t ask me that.
And why not? I dont understand what are you!
I’m the same as you.
Yeah, sure... (laughing)  30.
(begging to leave the leaving room) Look, can we talk some other time? I really...
(he stands up) Wait, wait... I just need to know when you’re moving out of this apartment.
I‘1l let you know as soon as I find something.
How much time are we talking about?
A few weeks.
(he turns violent) No, not a few weeks. Give me an exact date or I'll kick you out. Marina faces him defiantly.
You know what? Go away from my house.
This isn’t your house. Marina walks to the entrance and Bruno chases her. He gra her against the wall, Marina breathes heavily and Bruno stares really close to her face.
Incredible. My dad was crazy. He let go of Marina and leaves.
If you steal anything, I’11l know.

Hey Bruno! My name is Marina. Bye. Marina slams the door behind Bruno.  35 36 37 31. INT. ORLANDO'S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM -- DAY 35 Marina wears a blue jeans dress, she stare at the mirror. grabs her purse that is on top of the bed, she sees again key with the 181 number written on it. INT. ORLANDO’S CAR - CARWASH -- DAY 36 Marina’s car enters the carwash tunnel. The running water the dryers... It’s the closest thing she’s had to a peace moment. Protected in this solitary space, Marina lets her head fall back and closes her eyes. She sings quietly. As the soap falls over the windshield, Marina looks back through the rearview mirror: ORLANDO IS SITTING IN THE BACKSEAT. The spinning brushes run over the windows, making the car dark. Marina can’t tear her eyes away from Orlando throug the rearview mirror; his face is hidden in the moving sha and lights. Orlando now turns around and looks directly at her. Is sh losing her mind?
Overwhelmed, Marina covers her face with her hands as she waits in line for the cash register. She fails to realize that it’s her turn.
Miss...? Miss? Marina snaps back. She advances.
I’ve got to pay for the wash. The CASHIER (30) takes a look at her exhausted, upset demeanor.
You need a cup of coffee.
(staring back at her) Ok, one expresso.
How would you like it?  38 39 32.
Double.

Marina drives the now spotless car down a highway. Anothe cathartic song is playing on the radio, at full volume. “Natural Woman” performed by Aretha Franklin. Marina turn onto a busy street. It’s an office buildings area. A DOOR receives her, she pull down the window.
Hi, good morning.
Hi, good morning.
I’m bringing this car to Sonia... I don*t know her last name.
Yes, Sonia Bunster. Yes, she told me to inform her about your arriving. Please park in the -4th floor, parking space number 5. She'll come and pick up the car.
She wants me to wait down there?
Yes, that’s what she told me.
Ok, thank you.
You’re welcome, go ahead. Marina continue driving.

The car is parked. Marina waits besides it for SONIA (48) come down. sees a woman making gestures at her from the sidewalk. It SONIA (48), attractive, with panache, dressed formally. T size each other up in a glance.  33.
Hello
Hello, Sonia. Sonia stares back at her, unable to react.

I’m sorry. They shake hands. But Sonia is still stupefied. Marina responds with a gesture: this is me. SONIA (CONT’D) I've been wondering how is your face for about a year, It's different like this, face to face.
Of course. Sonia still can’t believe her eyes.
As you can see... bones and flesh.
Yes, it’s just that... I can’t imagine Orlando being with you. That’s all.
Oh. Ok.
Don't treat me so formal.
Eh... Here are the car keys. Sonia receives them.
Thank you.
The documents are in the glove compartment.  34.

Ok. Excuse me. (lamenting herself, whispering) Pure quantum physics. Sonia checks inside the car, then emerges and opens the trunk: it’s filled with color samples, books, and other products from Orlando’s printing press. Sonia slams the trunk shut, places both hands on the car, lowers her head. It truly is a difficult moment for her.
(without looking at her) I don’t want to talk about the apartment right now. Just move out as quickly as possible.
Okay. Thank you. (sincerely) Sonia, I’m so sorry about how things turned out.
(looking up at her now, hurt) Are you sorry for the whole soap opera, or for this episode in particular?
For the way in which things happened. A look of frustration grows over Sonia’s face. She needs express what she’s feeling.

Look, I was 38 years old when I married Orlando. We were together for 9. We were a completely normal couple. We had a normal life... (recalling, painfully) So when he came and explained to me... I... So then I thought that... I’m sorry if it sounds crude and direct of me to say this, but I really think that this is... just perversion.  35. Marina feels loathing and compassion towards her at the s time.
I’m sorry, but... It’s that when I look you, I don’t know what I’m looking at. Pause. Sonia knows that she’s crossing a line. SONIA (CONT’D) A chimera, that’s what I see.
A chimera... Ok. Marina is taken aback by the sentence.
I’m sorry. Both are completely engrossed by each other.
There’s no need to be sorry. You’re normal. You're fine. Marina begins to walk away. Sonia follows here to the elevator. A MAN IN A GREY SUITE is standing there waiting the elevator to arrive.
Hi
Hi
Hi Sonia
Hi Pablo. How are you?
Im fine and you?
Fine. Thank you
Good. The elevator arrives and the three of them jump in.  40 4l 36.
Marina, Man in a Grey Suit and Sonia are experience a awk moment on the elevator. Nobody speaks.
Marina exits the elevator and Sonia follows here behind.
(severely) Is it clear to you that my 7 year old daughter will be at the wake this afternoon?
Yes. And I would love to know where it’s being held. I know how to be discreet. Sonia is shocked by the fact that Marina is even consider the idea of attending.
But don’t even think about going.
I have the right to say goodbye to him, too. Sonia tries not to lose control.

Look, it’s my problem now. You already went through a hard time. Now all the paperwork is up to me. And in fact, I’d like to compensate you for everything that you've done. Really, so that you can be at ease. You don’t need to go anywhere, or do anything else. And we're going to handle this ina civilized way, so we can both be satisfied.
I don’t need your money, ma’am. Did you call Investigations Police?  42 43 37. Marina is unable to read her.
No. Well, in any case, I apologize. I’m just looking out for my love ones. That’s all.
Orlando was a loved one to me.

Yes, but you aren't coming to the funeral. Or the wake. Do you understand? I don't know how to explain it to you. What you want me to say? Daniel. You are not going to the funeral... Or any place. Marina can’t believe it. Marina looks at her fearlessly. Sonia needs to be sure. She gathers strength in order to herself clear. SONIA (CONT’D) Please... Let us live this mourning as a family. As it’s supposed to be. Do not show up. I’m asking you as a mother. Just think that there’s an entire family, devastated. In shock. Sonia walks always and gets in the elevator. SONIA (CONT’D) I would give a lung for my daughter.
Marina is on the bus. A brief pause in this battle.

location: FORENSIC MEDICINE INSTITUTE/ HALLWAY AND STAIRCASE-

text: Marina and Adriana are standing at the entrance of the Institute.
Adriana, I wanted to apologize for not calling... Adriana is carrying her file with her.  38.
